description: Pre-computed global tRNA coordinates for common model organisms
citation: White, Laura K. (2025). tRNAs in space: Standardized coordinates for tRNA analysis. https://github.com/lkwhite/tRNAs-in-space

ecoliK12_global_coords.tsv.notes: Complete set of E. coli K12 MG1655 tRNAs from GtRNAdb

sacCer_global_coords.tsv.notes: Nuclear and mitochondrial tRNAs. Mitochondrial tRNAs may need additional curation due to non-standard structures (see README)
sacCer_global_coords.tsv.quality: medium (mitochondrial tRNAs have limited model support)
warnings: Mitochondrial tRNA alignments may be inaccurate due to lack of fungal mitochondrial models in R2DT
For mitochondrial tRNAs, consider manual curation or refer to Reinsch & Garcia 2025

hg38_global_coords.tsv.notes: Complete set of human nuclear and mitochondrial tRNAs from GtRNAdb

steps.name: R2DT annotation
steps.description: Annotate tRNA sequences with Sprinzl positions using R2DT

steps.name: Coordinate transformation
steps.description: Convert Sprinzl annotations to global equal-spaced coordinates

validation.test_coverage: All pre-computed files pass validation tests in test_trnas_in_space.py

usage.documentation: See docs/OUTPUT_FORMAT.md for detailed column descriptions

references.title: R2DT: a comprehensive platform for visualizing RNA secondary structure
GtRNAdb 2.0: an expanded database of transfer RNA genes
Compilation of tRNA sequences and sequences of tRNA genes

changes: Initial release with E. coli, S. cerevisiae, and H. sapiens datasets
Complete region annotations for all tRNAs
Validated output format and data quality
